summary: 1999  was a common year starting on Friday of the Gregorian calendar.
full_text:
The 1999 Salt Lake City tornado was a very rare tornado that occurred in Salt Lake City, Utah on August 11, 1999, during an unusually strong summer monsoon season. It was among the most notable tornadoes to hit west of the Great Plains in the 20th century and the second tornado to hit in Utah that resulted in a fatality . This was the sixth significant tornado in Utah since June 1963.
^ Clayton Brough; Dan Brown; David James; Dan Pope; Steve Summy . "Utah's Tornadoes & Waterspouts - 1847 to the present". National Weather Service. Retrieved 2007-08-04.
title: 1999 Salt Lake City tornado
